DOC.brief_summary: The primary hypothesis preterm infant less equal 32 week gestation weigh 1001-2500 gram birth increase weight gain feed goal 180-200 ml/kg/day commonly use feed goal 140-160 ml/kg/day
DOC.brief_title: Randomized Controlled Trial Higher-Volume Feedings Preterm Neonates
DOC.detailed_description: The propose trial design test primary hypothesis preterm infant weigh 1001-2500 gram birth less equal 32 week gestation , feed goal 180-200 ml/kg/day increase weight gain ( g/k/day ) time enrollment discharge home 36 week post-menstrual age ( PMA ) ( whichever come first ) commonly use feed goal volume 140-160 ml/kg/day ( usual feeding goal ) . This pilot study determine safety increase volume feeding oppose fortification feeding .
DOC.criteria: Inborn outborn infant bear gestational age 32 week less ; Birthweight 10012500 ; Feeding volume least 120 ml/kg/day ; Enrolled prior 28 day age prior exceed 32 week Hemodynamically significant patent ductus arteriosis ; History necrotizing enterocolitis Bell Stage II great ; Known gastrointestinal neurologic malformation ; Prior plan enrollment NICHD MILK Trial ; Terminal illness decision withhold limit support
